Class FleskPlugins::CaptchaImageChallenge
In: lib/captcha_image_challenge.rb
Parent: CaptchaChallenge

A CAPTCHA challenge where an image with text is generated. A human can read the text with relative ease, while most robots can not. There are accessibility problems with this challenge, though, as people with reduced or no vision are unlikely to pass the test.

Methods

correct?   file_path   generate   new   prune   write  

Constants

WORDS = 'gorilla costume, superman, chuck norris, xray vision, ahoy me hearties, chunky bacon, latex, rupert murdoch, clap your hands, year 2000, sugar coated, coca cola, rastafarian, airbus a380'.split(/,\s+/)
DEFAULT_DIR = 'captcha'
WRITE_DIR = File.join(RAILS_ROOT, 'public', 'images')
DEFAULT_FILETYPE = 'jpg'

Public Class methods

new(options = {})

Creates an image challenge. It takes an optional hash parameter with the following options:

  • :ttl - Time to live. The challenge expires after ttl seconds. Default is 1200 (20 minutes).
  • :string - The text to generate in the image. This option probably has limited use.
  • :dir - The directory in which to store the generated image.
  • :filename - The filename to use for the generated image (without the extension like png or jpg). Default is to generate a random filename.
  • :filetype - The file extension (and file type) to use for the generated image. Default is "jpg".

[Source]

    # File lib/captcha_image_challenge.rb, line 33
33:     def initialize(options = {})
34:       super
35:       
36:       options = {
37:         :string => config['words'] ? config['words'][rand(config['words'].size)] : WORDS[rand(WORDS.size)],
38:         :dir => config['default_dir'] || DEFAULT_DIR,
39:         :filetype => config['default_filetype'] || DEFAULT_FILETYPE
40:       }.update(options)
41: 
42:       self.string = options[:string]
43:       self.dir = options[:dir]
44:       self.filetype = options[:filetype]
45:       self.filename = options[:filename] || generate_filename
46: 
47:       write_to_store
48:     end
prune()

Deletes old image files. Also calls CaptchaChallenge.prune

[Source]

     # File lib/captcha_image_challenge.rb, line 138
138:     def prune
139:       store.transaction{
140:         if store.root?(:captchas)
141:           store[:captchas].each_with_index{|c,i|
142:             if c.is_a?(self.class) && c.expired?
143:               if File.exists?(File.join(WRITE_DIR, c.file_path))
144:                 begin
145:                   File.unlink(File.join(WRITE_DIR, c.file_path))
146:                 rescue Exception
147:                 end
148:               end
149:             end
150:           }
151:         end
152:       }
153:       super
154:     end#prune

generate(options = {})

Generates the image. Takes an optional parameter containing options used when generating the image. These are:

  • :fontsize - The font size of the generated text in pt. Default 25.
  • :padding - The padding put around the text (in px). Should not be too small if the text is rotated. Default is 20.
  • :color - Text colour. Default is ‘000000’ (black).
  • :background - Background colour. Default is ‘ffffff’ (white).
  • :fontweight - Font weight of generated text. Can be "normal" or "bold". Default is "bold".
  • :rotate - Whether the text should be rotated or not. Default is true.
  • :font - The font to use. Can be a font name or the full path to a font file.

[Source]

     # File lib/captcha_image_challenge.rb, line 65
 65:     def generate(options = {})
 66:       options = {
 67:         :fontsize => 25,
 68:         :padding => 20,
 69:         :color => '#000',
 70:         :background => '#fff',
 71:         :fontweight => 'bold',
 72:         :rotate => true,
 73:         :font => config['font']
 74:       }.update(options)
 75: 
 76:       options[:fontweight] = case options[:fontweight]
 77:         when 'bold' then 700
 78:         else 400
 79:       end
 80:       
 81:       text = Magick::Draw.new
 82:       text.pointsize = options[:fontsize]
 83:       text.font_weight = options[:fontweight]
 84:       text.fill = options[:color]
 85:       text.gravity = Magick::CenterGravity
 86:       text.font = options[:font] if options[:font]
 87:       
 88:       #rotate text 5 degrees left or right
 89:       text.rotation = (rand(2)==1 ? 5 : -5) if options[:rotate]
 90:       
 91:       metric = text.get_type_metrics(self.string)
 92: 
 93:       #add bg
 94:       canvas = Magick::ImageList.new
 95:       canvas << Magick::Image.new(metric.width+options[:padding], metric.height+options[:padding]){
 96:         self.background_color = options[:background]
 97:       }
 98: 
 99:       #add text
100:       canvas << Magick::Image.new(metric.width+options[:padding], metric.height+options[:padding]){
101:         self.background_color = '#000F'
102:       }.annotate(text, 0, 0, 0, 0, self.string).wave(5, 50)
103: 
104:       canvas << Magick::Image.new(metric.width+options[:padding], metric.height+options[:padding]){
105:         p = Magick::Pixel.from_color(options[:background])
106:         p.opacity = Magick::MaxRGB/2
107:         self.background_color = p
108:       }.add_noise(Magick::LaplacianNoise)
109: 
110:       self.image = canvas.flatten_images.blur_image(1)
111:     end
